docs.lead_paragraph: While on the subject of pregnancy, I received an e-mail from a reader, Rebecca, who is wrestling with whether or not to have a baby.
docs.abstract: Looking for advice on whether to become pregnant if it means weaning off anti-depression and anti-anxiety drugs.
docs.snippet: Looking for advice on whether to become pregnant if it means weaning off anti-depression and anti-anxiety drugs.

docs.lead_paragraph: A first worry of pregnant women (at least based on the unofficial measure of how often it comes up in Motherlode comments) appears to be what they eat, how much weight they gain, and how it affects their developing child.
docs.abstract: Who decides how much stress is too much during a pregnancy?
docs.snippet: Who decides how much stress is too much during a pregnancy?

docs.lead_paragraph: The absence of a protein that coats sperm and allows them to reach an egg more easily could be the potential cause for unexplained cases of male infertility.

headline.seo: Study Links Male Infertility to a Missing Protein

docs.lead_paragraph: Given some of the things Jon Stewart has said about Republicans on “The Daily Show,” don’t expect his former longtime head writer David Javerbaum to be gentle on the target of his stage musical that will be presented at a coming New York festival: James G. Watt, the Secretary of the Interior in the Reagan administration.

headline.main: Musical by Former ‘Daily Show’ Head Writer Chosen for Festival in New York

docs.abstract: James G. Watt, secretary of the Interior in the Reagan administration, is the subject of the rock musical “Watt?!?”
docs.snippet: James G. Watt, secretary of the Interior in the Reagan administration, is the subject of the rock musical “Watt?!?”

docs.lead_paragraph: What makes a female athlete different from a male athlete? Watching Abby Wambach leap above defenders in a World Cup soccer game to head the ball decisively into the net, or seeing her teammate Megan Rapinoe streak a pass down the pitch, the answer might seem to be: not much. As a group, female athletes, like their male counterparts, display coordination, strength, grace, speed, stamina and a bracing competitiveness.

headline.main: Athletic Performance and the Monthly Cycle

docs.abstract: Menstruation, with its accompanying fluctuating levels of the female sex hormone estrogen, can have a considerable effect on how a woman’s body responds to the demands of exercise and competition.
docs.snippet: Menstruation, with its accompanying fluctuating levels of the female sex hormone estrogen, can have a considerable effect on how a woman’s body responds to the demands of exercise and competition.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health insurers continue to charge fees that make it difficult, and sometimes impossible, for women to prevent unintended pregnancy. That could soon change.
docs.snippet: Health insurers continue to charge fees that make it difficult, and sometimes impossible, for women to prevent unintended pregnancy. That could soon change.

docs.lead_paragraph: Should states take children from their parents and place them in foster care in cases of “life-threatening childhood obesity”? It is not a new question (I wrote this magazine article about it several years ago), but it was given new amplification and caused a new uproar when advocated in a commentary in the most recent Journal of the American Medical Association.

headline.main: Removing  Obese Children From Their Parents

docs.abstract: How what you eat in utero can affect your child’s health for decades.
docs.snippet: How what you eat in utero can affect your child’s health for decades.
